description:
Razer appears to have removed the ability for U.S. consumers to directly purchase its gaming laptops, with the Blade gaming laptops now gone from its website. Razer’s move comes as the Trump administration raises tariffs on Chinese goods to over 100 percent.

At press time, the “gaming laptops” section of Razer.com only allows consumers to buy skins, not the laptops themselves. Those laptops used to include the Razer Blade 14, the Razer Blade 16, and the Razer Blade 18. Those listings have now been removed, according to web pages viewable by PCWorld.com as well as
title: Razer laptops vanish from Razer’s site as tariffs skyrocket
